Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Same for Chameleon. So they wouldn't need to develop their own ledger app. We can piggy back of the kmd app

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: As far as I know ledger isn't available in Agama so I can't answer that last question

Author: riseandfall#3726
Content: It should be the recommended option (to use the same keys as for Komodo) to my opinion.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Agreed

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: They should be the same keys since they are based on the mnemonic seed

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: The only thing you can change is the derivation path but if it's the normal one you get the same addresses

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: With Magnum you don't generate new addresses everytime you make a transaction. I believe with ledger it cycles through new addresses but you can recover them all with the same seed

Author: riseandfall#3726
Content: Exactly....and even considering there are 5000 different chains on KMD the risk of collision is hugely small

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: So you can use one privatekey on all kmd chains

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: If you don't generate change addresses it would mean one seed accesses funds in all chains

Author: riseandfall#3726
Content: It's also interesting to play with the derivations paths

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: If you use the privatekey in a native wallet though and generate a change address, you can't recover it with the mnemonic seed. You need the privatekey

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: I've been learning more about the paths recently. I've been playing with a non custodial payment processor

Author: riseandfall#3726
Content: But what I wanted to say is that KMD  offers security (by dPOW), a integrated wallet (with Agama) and also ease of use (because users can use their ledger device for any new asset)....no need to do specific development for that

Author: riseandfall#3726
Content: It's important this last point

Author: riseandfall#3726
Content: Before you talked to me I was thinking about some prefixes to identify the chains...but maybe playing with derivation paths is a good option....but as you said there is something even more simple : using the same keying system as Komodo main chain

Author: riseandfall#3726
Content: And so this potential new asset chain takes benefit also from the ledger app (using agama with ledger)

Author: riseandfall#3726
Content: I was just thinking today that it's non n√©gligeable point

Author: riseandfall#3726
Content:
Your proposal (using the same keying system as for KMD) is simple and smart. Someone using just ledger wallet will have access to KMD chain only...And someone using Agama wallet with ledger will have the choice of the chain. And ledger can well sign.
The other option would be to play with derivation paths.
But the most important is that any new chain hosted on Komodo can well propose easily to users the possibility to store this new asset using ledger.
It's important I think for newbies.

Author: riseandfall#3726
Content: Above all what is important is a clear policy for future asset chains. It will make the job must easier for agama maintenance/updates

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: launch with `-reindex` param

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: dont forget to backup wallet.dat or dumpprivkey as needed

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: if reindex doesnt work, you'll need to clean out the files and folders in  `~/.komodo`  which are mentioned here - https://support.komodoplatform.com/en/support/solutions/articles/29000024513-how-to-resync-komodo-from-scratch-in-agama-windows-linux-osx-

Content: @CryptoCurb currently to get your rewards on ledger you only have to make sure your app is updated on the hardware device.
